settings.ingredient_description:
KSM-66Â® is the world's most clinically studied ashwagandha extract â€” a full-spectrum root extract standardized to 5% withanolides. Unlike generic ashwagandha products that use leaf or aerial parts, KSM-66Â® uses only the root, preserving the natural balance of active compounds exactly as studied in clinical trials.

The patented milk-based extraction process â€” developed over 14 years of R&D â€” maintains the natural ratio of withanolides without harsh chemical solvents, producing the most bioavailable form of ashwagandha available.

settings.heading: Clinical Studies

settings.fda_disclaimer: These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. Individual results may vary.

settings.study_title: Safety and Efficacy of a High-Concentration Full-Spectrum Extract of Ashwagandha Root in Reducing Stress and Anxiety
settings.description: Adults with chronic stress receiving 600mg/day KSM-66Â® showed a 27.9% reduction in serum cortisol and significant improvements on all stress-assessment scales compared to placebo.

settings.study_title: Efficacy and Safety of Ashwagandha Root Extract on Sleep Quality in Insomnia and Anxiety
settings.description: Participants taking 600mg/day KSM-66Â® showed significant improvement in sleep quality, with sleep efficiency improving from 75.6% to 83.5% â€” a clinically meaningful change.

settings.study_title: Body Weight Management in Adults Under Chronic Stress Through Ashwagandha Root Extract
settings.journal: J Evid Based Complement Altern Med
settings.description: Chronically stressed adults receiving KSM-66Â® showed a 44% reduction in perceived stress (PSS score) and significant improvements in food cravings and reactive eating.

settings.study_title: Examining the Effect of Withania Somnifera on Muscle Strength and Recovery
settings.description: Healthy men receiving 600mg/day KSM-66Â® showed significantly greater increases in muscle strength, muscle size, and cardiorespiratory endurance (VO2max) vs. placebo.
